review: Good cord cutter option. Content wise it offers almost everything. Very easy to use. Menu options are a little confusing to some in my family. I setup pin requirements after a few programs were accidentally purchased. Speed is the biggest issue. Menus can be slow to respond. Streaming speed is slow at times. I do prefer very much to the Roku stick and Roku 2. Picture quality is very good.Still my three year old + Apple TV blows the Fire TV stick away in menu organization and overall speed and performance. I really only use the Fire Stick for Sling streaming. Once Apple brings their streaming service in this fall I doubt I will continue using the Fire TV stick. I did try the Fire TV full size and it was much more responsive. I just did not want to pay that much (I have three TV's , each with a Fire TV stick and Apple TV). I'm saving $127 a month after dropping cable. I hear the Roku 3 has good performance. Still I think the Apple TV is a better streaming device with one exception, content. That will change once they go live with their streaming service I think.

review: One of the reasons I was thinking of buying this was to cast my Kindle Fire HD to my TV. After numerous attempts, I was able to pair it with my friend's Fire TV Stick so I bought my own. Since setting up my Fire TV Stock, I have not been able to cast my Fire or my phone to it. This really seems temperamental. I did use this to watch the PBS channel and it works great for that and I want to try some of the games, but considering the casting was one of the primary reasons I bought this, I'm pretty disappointed.
